question:
Which among the following statements is/are correct about migration and its consequences?
  1. The physiological characteristics of humanity in most parts of the world are a result of such intermixing of people from various parts of the world.
  2. Till the beginning of the twentieth century about 90% of the European emigrants to Australia and New Zealand were Arabs.
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation: Psychological consequences of migration relate to the process of adaptation. In fact the physiological characteristics of humanity in most parts of the world are a result of such intermixing of people from various parts of the world. Till the beginning of the twentieth century about 90% of the European emigrants to Australia and New Zealand were Britons.
